result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian K Bennett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian K Bennett

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per RASO - mandatory jail time has been served

Defendant Brian K Bennett in court with attorney Domingo S. Cruz.  Defendant Brian K Bennett in custody.  Erika Frank Motsch for Tom Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
On a plea to Count 1, state is moving to remove the domestic abuse enhancer.
Plea - Ct.1 - NC.
BTC: Ct.1 - GUILTY.    Domestic abuse enhancer for Count 1 - dismissed.   Ct.2 - DRI.
30 days RCJ;
cfts;
cc are waived.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 30, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with the victim CTW (person, property, residence or family).   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Brian K Bennett in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Defendant Brian K Bennett in custody.  Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
